title: Raheem Sterling calls out Bulgaria coach after England players are racially abused
text:
Raheem Sterling was subjected to racial abuse by Bulgaria supporters (Picture: Getty)

Manchester City ace Raheem Sterling called out Bulgaria coach Krasimir Balakov after England’s black players were subjected to sickening racial abuse during the Three Lions’ 6-0 win in Sofia.

England anticipated problems before the match and decided as a group that they would be prepared to walk off should racist abuse occur but Balakov took exception to the suggestion that the home fans would target Gareth Southgate’s side.

Balakov said that English football has a bigger problem with racism than Bulgaria does and suggested that the FA focus on issues on their own patch.

However, England’s fears were proved to be correct when the game was stopped in the 28th minute to warn the home fans that the game will be abandoned if they persist with their chants.

Sterling scored twice during the win but the victory was overshadowed (Picture: Getty)

England decided at half-time not to walk off and Sterling scored twice in the second half to complete a 6-0 rout.

And, taking to Twitter afterwards, Sterling found the perfect opportunity to raise Balakov’s comments by quote tweeting an article containing the manager’s comments.

Mmmmh … Not sure about this one chief https://t.co/Jyjr6vFtA8 — Raheem Sterling (@sterling7) October 14, 2019

‘Mmmmh … Not sure about this one chief,’ wrote Sterling.

Feeling sorry for Bulgaria to be represented by such idiots in their stadium. Anyway.. 6-0 and we go back home, at least we did our job. Safe travel to our fans, u guys did well 🤟🏾❤️ — Raheem Sterling (@sterling7) October 14, 2019

Sterling followed up the tweet with a wider comment on the disgraceful scenes in the stadium, saying he felt ‘sorry’ for fans to have to be associated with such ‘idiots’.

‘Feeling sorry for Bulgaria to be represented by such idiots in their stadium. Anyway.. 6-0 and we go back home, at least we did our job. Safe travel to our fans, u guys did well,’ said Sterling.
